playerItems.h1: Union Health Minister confirms two Nipah virus deaths in Kerala.

playerItems.p: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said Two deaths reported from Kerala’s Kozhikode district were caused by Nipah virus
Central team of experts has been sent to Kerala to assist the State government in the management of the Nipah virus infection
Samples of four more people from Kerala have been sent to the National Institute of Virology in Pune to test for the deadly virus

playerItems.h1: 40% sitting MPs have criminal cases, 25% serious criminal cases: ADR

playerItems.p: Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR) and National Election Watch (NEW) have analysed the self-sworn affidavits of 763 sitting MPs out of 776 seats of Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha
The average worth of assets per MP from Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha is ₹38.33 crores and 53 (7%) are billionaires
306 (40%) sitting MPs have declared criminal cases against them

Out of the 763 sitting MPs analysed, 306 (40%) sitting MPs have declared criminal cases against them and 194 (25%) sitting MPs have declared serious criminal cases including cases related to murder, attempt to murder, kidnapping, crimes against women, etc, it said

storyUrl: 25-30% increase in footfall at ATMs after UPI-ATM-13-09-2023

playerItems.h1: Bankers target 25-30% increase in footfall at ATMs after UPI-ATM services

playerItems.p: India’s first UPI-ATM feature was launched by the National Payments Corporation of India on September 5, this year
It uses a cardless cash withdrawal technology that makes the process easier and more convenient
At present, the State-owned Bank of Baroda (BoB) has enabled the UPI ATM facility at over 6,000 ATMs across the country
